docs.lead_paragraph: What, exactly, is it about Broncos quarterback Tim Tebow that so fascinates and provokes us? Why do some people project onto him the best of this country — and the worst?

headline.seo: Fascinated by Tim Tebow on More Than Sundays - Dan Barry
headline.main: He’s a Quarterback, He’s a Winner, He’s a TV Draw, He’s a Verb
headline.print_headline: He’s a Quarterback, He’s a Winner, He’s a TV Draw, He’s a Verb

docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column explores the national fascination with Denver Broncos quarterback Tim Tebow, who has inspired both adoration and contempt in football fans; Tebow is a deeply religious person who often wins in spectacular ways, though critics maintain that his limited passing skills do not warrant praise.
docs.snippet: What, exactly, is it about Broncos quarterback Tim Tebow that so fascinates and provokes us? Why do some people project onto him the best of this country — and the worst?

headline.main: Antidepressant Use Linked to Increased Pulmonary Hypertension Risk in Infants

docs.abstract: New research that shows a stronger link between S.S.R.I. use in mothers and pulmonary hypertension in infants can only make an already difficult choice harder.
docs.snippet: New research that shows a stronger link between S.S.R.I. use in mothers and pulmonary hypertension in infants can only make an already difficult choice harder.

docs.lead_paragraph: A study published in the British Medical Journal this week provides stronger evidence that taking some antidepressants during pregnancy doubles the risk of a baby developing pulmonary hypertension. Researchers have long suspected a link between the use of selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, or S.S.R.I.'s, and the condition, but previous studies have been small and inconclusive (with results ranging from there being no link to a six times greater risk).

headline.main: Antidepressant Use Linked to Increased Pulmonary Hypertension Risk in Infants

docs.abstract: New research that shows a stronger link between S.S.R.I. use in mothers and pulmonary hypertension in infants can only make an already difficult choice harder.
docs.snippet: New research that shows a stronger link between S.S.R.I. use in mothers and pulmonary hypertension in infants can only make an already difficult choice harder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Saturday in Houston, Deena Kastor, the 2004 Olympic bronze medalist, will run her first marathon since London in April 2010, hoping to qualify for the 2012 Games.

headline.seo: Deena Kastor Sees Olympic Marathon Trials as a New Start
headline.main: Kastor, After Pregnancy, Sees Trials as New Start
headline.print_headline: Kastor, After Pregnancy, Sees Trials as New Start

docs.abstract: Marathoner Deena Kastor, who earned bronze in 2004 Olympics, is preparing for Olympic trials in Houston; it is her first marathon since 2010 and marks her return to competition after pregnancy.
docs.snippet: Saturday in Houston, Deena Kastor, the 2004 Olympic bronze medalist, will run her first marathon since London in April 2010, hoping to qualify for the 2012 Games.

headline.main: Melinda Gates Answers Questions, Part II

docs.abstract: Melinda Gates and Nicholas Kristof answer readers’ questions about the developing world.
docs.snippet: Melinda Gates and Nicholas Kristof answer readers’ questions about the developing world.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Gates, of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, recently returned from a three-day trip to Bangladesh. She, along with Nick, agreed to answer readers' questions about development issues focusing on that part of the world. Here is the second of three installments.

headline.main: Melinda Gates Answers Questions, Part II

docs.abstract: Melinda Gates, just back from a trip to Bangladesh, along with Nicholas Kristof, answer readers' questions about the developing world.
docs.snippet: Melinda Gates, just back from a trip to Bangladesh, along with Nicholas Kristof, answer readers' questions about the developing world.

headline.main: Pistons, Prince Frustrated by Poor Start

docs.abstract: The Pistons rebuilding process is going slowly and painfully in a 2-8 start.
docs.snippet: The Pistons rebuilding process is going slowly and painfully in a 2-8 start.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pistons starting small forward Tayshaun Prince has seen just about everything in his nine seasons with the team. He's been part of a championship team in 2004, one that came so close to repeating in 2005, and has made six trips to the Eastern Conference finals.
